alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Harlan; Johnson; Knott; Letcher; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 3:11PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, Martin, Letcher, southeastern Johnson, eastern Knott, Floyd and Pike Counties through 400 PM EST... At 310 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meally to Beaver Junction to Blue Moon to near Pennington Gap. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Prestonsburg, Martin, Allen, Justell, Betsy Layne, Alvin, Aluba, Harold, Emma and Davisport around 315 PM EST. Pikeville, Inez, Coal Run Village, Stidham, Tomahawk, Endicott, McCombs, Wells, Add and Debord around 320 PM EST. Moree, Piso, Gulnare, Pleasant, Jarad, Heenan, Clover Fork, Job, Prince and Big Black Mountain around 325 PM EST. Varney, Coalpoint, Heisey, McClure, Laura, Threeforks, Lovely, Sidney, Preece and Andy around 330 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Forest Hills, Rural, Oppy, Whitepost, Conder, Hatfield Station, Pilgrim, Turkey Creek, Beauty and Canada. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 9. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County near mile marker 20. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 1. U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Floyd; Harlan; Johnson; Knott; Letcher; Martin; Pike
